intro: Macroptilium cochleatum, commonly known as the spiralleaf burr legume, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is characterized by its spirally arranged leaves and distinctive, spiny pods that enclose its seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed or arid environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
